# Draft:Kikuyu traditional dance

----
kikuyu traditional dances are dances commonly found amongst the Kikuyus who live around the slopes of Mount Kenya region..Kikuyu traditional dances were mainly for entertainment and also for occasions such as initiations ,harvesting ,childbirth and marriage ceremonies.
Famous kikuyu traditional dances.
The earliest traditional kikuyu dance was the muthigiruthis dance , the dancers could move in a file ,accompanied by the karing`aring`a ,a traditional instrument and then two steps , bend down and move back
The most common Kikuyu traditional dance is mwomboko dance.The mwomboko dance is said to have originated from Europeans therefore the dance can be termed as borrowed .Mwomboko dance resembles the fox trot and it was introduced by the soldiers who returned from world war1. The arising of the mwomboko dance among the kikuyus was as a result of abolishment of the muthigiru dance by the colonial government due to its social protest origins.
During this dances ,the kikuyus had some musical instruments that complimented the dances .They the kikuyus did not have many musical instruments because most of their songs and dances did not require elaborate accompaniment .The most common traditional dance instruments were the drums[kihembe] ,small rattles [njingiri],large rattles[kagamba], horn[coro]and flute[muturiru]
